Posts.Content: Moan - there are SO MANY THINGS you dont get informed about..no one told me about a fairly local support group...for one example... & I didnt know about knitted knockers either and could go on but I wont! Zen
Posts.Title: Paying for Letrozole

Posts.Content: Good for you..progress! Karen...  You may well be surprised by what they don't tell you! another example - the problems of side effects with hormone therapy.in my case with anastrozole. I know we all react differently to different drugs but it is only through this site that I found out all sorts of things re anastrozole.  if you live  near or with reasonable access to a cancer centre you are really lucky,(?) they seem to offer all sorts of varied help,Courses etc., perhaps even some Outreach Courses as well, not so where I am....rural area. Another moan over!    Zen if anyone is over 60..maybe 65 they can apply for Attendance Allowance BUT you NEED Help completing the form from a  knowledgeable Welfare Benefits Officer as I was so lucky to find.   Zen
Posts.Title: Paying for Letrozole

Posts.Content: Hello from Zen, may I suggest in case you haven.t tried it or dont know about it...my saviour was the original Anastrozole made by Astra Zenaca.....yes, more expensive, request it..I did... OK lucky me! and got it...forget the generic brands of which there are several..I am tolf it is the 'fillers' in the generic brands that cause the problems.     Astra Zenica used to be ICI in case that helps!  Good luck & big hug  Zen
Posts.Title: Stopping Anastrazole early - advice please

Posts.Content: Hello tropicof.....may I suggest that a talk with a pharmacist could be useful? although having said that when I tried... the lady was Spanish... and I got the impression she hadn't got a clue about what I was asking her about e.g. fillers !!!   so got nowhere. Was the Vitamin D to help with side effects of Anastrozole? Does anyone know how/where to see online the lady surgeon who has had to deal with breast cancer? is she taking Anastrozole or similar? anyone know please?   Thank you       Zenxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxx
Posts.Title: Anastrozole/Letrozole & Joint Pain

Posts.Content: Thank you very much for your help. I do wonder if she - surgeon.. would be willing to share any thoughts/experiences if any... of 'hormone inhibitors' anastrozole etc., I suppose I should pluck up courage and just ask.......!? Thanks again  Zen xxxxxxxxxxxxxxxx
Posts.Title: Anastrozole/Letrozole & Joint Pain

Posts.Content: Hello Karen and thanks for your message.It is astonishing the number of us who are 'suffering' hope that is not too strong a word, with these blessed side effects and yes, it seems to me perhaps WE have to MAKE A FUSS!! Can anyone tell me please are all these welcomed communications on a 'thread' about anastrozole etc &  joint pain.....sorry but I am a bit 'limited!' computer wise...( and otherwise!!!!!!!!!  )  Zen xxxxxxxxxxxx
Posts.Title: Anastrozole/Letrozole & Joint Pain

Posts.Content: Hi Debs, well it is definitely hugs and rainbows to you as well....What is a patient CCG ?? please. What is the role of the Patient Ambassador? presume this it at your Surgery? When I asked at my Surgery, for the phone number to contact Macmillan Nurses, some time ago now, eventually a number was found but I was advised to get back to the Surgery for a further search if it was the wrong number! they had given me.   No support to speak of from my Surgery......in my experience.  I was told that I could refer myself for Counselling which I did , 6 sessions, very nice lady.I tried to refer myself back to her in May,  she had instructed me what to do and given me the number........left a message.....no reply. Seems to me that where you live may offer more in Support Services than other areas such as mine.It would be good to have some consistency, and all those who need it be given Arimidex as a matter of course instead of having to go through endless barriers of one sort or another.      Thank you for sharing... everyone Zen xxxxxxxxxx
Posts.Title: Anastrozole/Letrozole & Joint Pain

Posts.Content: Ok Kargus I will see what i can do.........thank you  good idea......Zen  xxxxxxxxxxxx
Posts.Title: Anastrozole/Letrozole & Joint Pain

Posts.Content: Hello all Anastrozole sufferers.....request Prescription for the Astra Zeneca Arimidex......the original patented Anastrozole..... it is more expensive then the generic versions such as Teva and Accord but it made my life and side effects.... much better. The last box  had on the side 44 Euros which I believe is around £38/9 pounds not the £70 -£80 pounds often quoted. The tablets look as though they are produced for the Polish market (?) but subtitles are on the box/tablet pack in English!     The oncologist advised the G.P surgery to prescribe them for me... over a year ago now and as I said things have been a lot better. Good luck!   Zen
Posts.Title: Anastrozole/Letrozole & Joint Pain

Posts.Content: hello Karen and anyone else following this!   I do agree with your sentence about the number of people suffering with the side effects of Anastrozole etc., surely someone somewhere should look into this and find a better solution?   Oncologists just seem to take it for granted that you will have side effects and just get on with it....other than to expect the 'runs' I was told nothing .....I found out from this site, little by little about the side effects and requested to go on Arimidex, the original  anastrozole made by Astra Zeneca, I read that the subsequent generic tablets that the problem is with the 'fillers' of the tablets not the A. itself.               As you probably know the Arimidex is the most expensive, why I have no idea....and  again... I agree with the comments that it makes no sense to have to take 'all sorts' of other tablets to allay the side effects. You see, it all comes down to money, nothing to do with how horrible they make you feel...not right is it? Presumably we have all paid into the NHS? so why should we have to have the cheapest 'aromatose  inhibitator' that make life pretty awful, as if we havent had enough to get through!   aaaaaaaaahhhhhhh grrrrrrrrh..makes me so mad!  Should we get a petition up!!??????????LOL        love Zen xx
Posts.Title: Anastrozole/Letrozole & Joint Pain

Posts.Content: Thank you Sally for this info. how do we tell everyone affected about this?   Brilliant! Zen
Posts.Title: Anastrozole/Letrozole & Joint Pain

Posts.Content: Hi there jo jo.... just to say I couldn't get on with Anastrozole Teva Brand and can only repeat, sorry if you missed it...try to get the Arimidex, the orginal make.. made  by Astra Zeneca  It has been suggested that if we could all report our problems with these side effects( you never know someone might take interest) via the yellow card system..sorry i haven't got the link right now and I am hoping to persuade Macmillan to promote the idea... Yes! oh the joys....we have enough to contend with without these various horrendous side effects? Thing is it is complicated as the side effects seem to vary ...? take care     Zen xxxxxxxxxxxx
Posts.Title: Anastrozole/Letrozole & Joint Pain

Posts.Content: Hello dalefarm..I would be very grateful to learn about Vitamin D supplement and therefore how it helps with the side effects of Anastrozole please.   And!!....which substitute for the Accord make are you on now please? many thank thanks  ....   Zen
Posts.Title: Anastrozole/Letrozole & Joint Pain

Posts.Content: Hello...must put my' four penneyworth' in! nothing for the South West either ...as usual...  Zen
Posts.Title: Cancer One Stop Shops Information

Posts.Content: Thank you Monika for your quick response and good wishes. Just to let you know I have updated my first  ever post in case you wish to read it again...Think the present 'trouble' is I have a 12 monthly Hospital tomorrow Friday 13th and on the 28th the next infusion at a different hospital. I dont suppose any of us can avoid getting anxious or more anxious around these times.... I do try to do some of the things or similar things you suggest, but recently I seem to have given in.. to staying in, in the quiet and doing my own thing...probably nothing much ! thing is my studio gets quite cold and I like many others I simply cant afford too much heating..there and at home. Hopefully tomorrow I am to have a talk about bras and protheses then I should have a clue as to what to do next..the price of bras!!!!!!? Thanks again    Angela
Posts.Title: Anastraloze side effects and older ladies without family.

Posts.Content: I believe I read a post recently on this site that the hormone inhibitor Anastraloze side effects include memory loss and weight gain. Can anyone confirm that this is correct as I cant find any mention of these symptoms  in the info that comes with the pack nor on this site under the heading for the drug. Also, I would like to pose the following questions which no doubt have been talked about before, so sorry to be repetitive... It seems to me that many older women like me (a very young 75!)  well their needs are not exactly being addressed say for e.g. bra catalogues seem to feature young - ish women perhaps because they cant get older ladies to be photographed?  and does anybody in the scheme of things pay any concern to those who live alone without much in the way of family, if indeed any family? Just so you know I had a double mastectomy just over a year ago and not finding things exactly easy now, although I recognise I have been, compared to others, very lucky. Having to get used to a new 'normal' as you all know it is hard. Thank you    Angela
Posts.Title: Anastraloze side effects and older ladies without family.

Posts.Content: Hello Maggie, thank you to you too for a quick helpful response. Hopefully I will get some bra /prostheses advice tomorrow on my 12 monthly Hospital visit. I will have a look at M&S website. I suppose in this situation  i.e.living alone I can deal with things 'my way' although that probably gets too over bearing at times, and I can understand how having to deal with close family and maybe perpetual questions can also be difficult. As usual no easy answers! Thing is I know friends think I should just 'get on with it' but I am not finding that too easy. Surprise surprise! maybe it is because I have 2 imminent Hospital visits + more anxiety? Best wishes to you and thank you Angela x
Posts.Title: Anastraloze side effects and older ladies without family.

Posts.Content: yes try and get Arimidex the original brand made by Astra Zeneca, after many different generic packets and lots of different side effects I eventually got onto Arimidex and life is better.......I read somewhere on here that it is the fillers they use in the generic packs that cause the problems...but I am not a pharmacist! However for something to be taken for a long time you need to be as 'comfortable' as possible don't you?     I requested via the oncology consultant to prescribe for me, & she passed the request (order!) to the Surgery.    One pack which I had recently had a price on the side of 44 Euros, not sure what that equated to in sterling, but therin lies  the problem because the generic packets cost pence....thats is why we get prescribed the cheaper versions I think!    Good luck!  Zen
Posts.Title: Anastrozole - side effects

Posts.Content: Hello...just to say I had several UTI's on Anastrozole various makes...but since being fortunate enough to have the Arimidex..no more UTI's . May I add, that I have just found many posts in my Spam folder re 'bras' and 'fears' so may I apologise if a reply has been anticipated..I will read them all shortly.     Thanks Zen
Posts.Title: Letrozole and UTI

Posts.Content: Hello Olivia Ruby well I am sorry that this will sound "I'm alright jack" because I have had 5 infusions of Zoledronic acid , one every 6 months with 1 to go.... on the NHS... so something is wrong somewhere? Who do you ask? the pharmacist? G.P.? Primary Care trust for your area if that is what they are still called? Someone  may know better than me the answer? I had flu like S/E symptoms the 1st time...paracetamol and rest then it passed after a couple of days, and vague aches & pains   after the others...however, I believe it is not advisable to have invasive dentistry whilst on bisphosphonates....sorry cant spell it...  so dental check up/treatment needed first... may I dare to suggest...and Good Luck !     Zen
Posts.Title: Zoledronic Acid

Posts.Content: Hi I have to ask...isn't the Alexander a private hospital? so that would be why you are expected to pay? I apologise if I am making the wrong assumptions. Blimey it is all so confusing and yet we all live in the same country, can anyone explain to me therefore why some get whatever and some dont please? Thanks Zen
Posts.Title: Zoledronic Acid

Posts.Content: Oh dear Tox....sorry to hear this......Whilst it was a while ago when I had the 1st infusion, I do recall the SE's passed in a couple of days.......to pour water on your troubles...sorry.... can I take it you know that you have to advise your dentist that you are having Z/A?...do hope you will feel a bit better soon..Zen xx
Posts.Title: Zoledronic Acid

Posts.Content: Hi to all....re zoladronic acid...I believe this 'post code lottery situation' has been mentioned in the newspapers???     Is there a need for a petition.....?  will Macmillan take up the cause for those having to pay I speculate?   I agree it is crazy and really unfair.    Write to M.P??? Jeremy Hunt???? Get a petition going on here?  Woman's Hour/   Jenny Murray??           Surely the oncologists could help? What happens to those on benefits who are expected to pay for it? Honestly I just dont understand how this 'system?' all works ........Zen
Posts.Title: Zoledronic Acid

Posts.Content: Hello Carolyn yes this is what we are talking about, except some patients ARE getting the treatment for FREE whilst  for 1 example... others are being asked to pay £800!!!  ( refer all recent input in the site when you get a chance to see it... under the heading of zoledronic acid... Best wishes  from   Zen
Posts.Title: Zoledronic Acid

Posts.Content: Thank you for the up date..re SE's after ZA infusion...after the 1st one I did have flu like symptoms...aches , low in energy ...and took paracetamol and it passed in a day or two.Of course the thing is concoctions of meds. can cause various SE's......!!!!!!!!! Subsequent infusions, the other 5, SE's gradually reduced, I had the 6th and last, as far as I know, last week..and no paracetamol....bfn      Zen
Posts.Title: Zoledronic Acid

Posts.Content: Hello Debs Have you any more information you could pass on please about 'mindfulness' and 'Hope' courses? thank you   Zen
Posts.Title: Just wondering if I'm normal

Posts.Content: Hello Chris77 if I can put in my tupenny worth!!     Hair...  best for me has been 'Plantur 39 ' Shampoo Boots £8.99 or thereabouts. I use the one for fine/brittle hair, and my hair has come on a treat. They do a version for 'coloured' hair as well. I use it every other day.Highly recommended!!   Anastrozole try to get yourself on the original make called ARIMIDEX ....    The generic ones that followed  -once Astra Zeneca had to release the 'patent' I think they call it, the horrible side effects started for many of us. Seemingly it is the 'fillers'  around the anastrozole they use that cause the problems. I asked my Oncologist to prescribe it for me and she did.   If only everyone was prescribed Arimidex life would be so much easier, as I think we have enough to put up with or have had enough without these horrible side effects. You wont be surprised to know that it all comes down to 'money' ....never mind the well being of the patient, so wrong. I wish Macmillan could take up this matter with whoever? pharmaceutical industry? the government (as if!!!?) any way moan over and Good luck     Zen xx
Posts.Title: RE: anastrozole

Posts.Content: Please could you tell me more about 'predict' Thank you
Posts.Title: Thinking of turning down chemo

Posts.Content: Hello Marie pepps 1234.......I dont wish to get your hopes up ..and of course I dont know your circumstances and it is none of my business!!!!   ...but.....I am wondering if there could be a need for a double check re entitlements/claims from another source of help/advice? It was thanks to this website that I by chance found Maggie's Online Cancer Services and got lots of help on line from their benefits adviser. Please note I am not trying to upset anyone at Macmillan... just telling how it was, by chance, that I got helped financially. We all need help one way or another?     Warmest wishes     Zen
Posts.Title: PIPS application

Posts.Content: 'Maggie's online'...... have a superb benefits adviser... I cant praise him enough. Zen
Posts.Title: PIPS application

Posts.Content: Re Hair thinning    Hello all.... When I first started on Anastrozole of various makes I experienced hair thinning. I read on here about the Shampoo Plantur 39 (Boots and others! £8.99) they do  one for fine brittle hair and one for coloured hair , my hair  is fine and fair,  improved greatly, gradually with shampoo used every other day. It comes in a lime green container. However, for those that dont know I also changed the Anastrozole to the one called  Arimidex made by Astra Zenica, ICI that was, they were the original makers of the tablets. The Oncologist requested the Prescription to the Surgery.      Whether it is a combination of the 2 or just the shampoo, who knows, but the shampoo is definatly worth a try....think its  German.....!You might get some info if you just 'Google' it!!  Good luck Zenxxxxxxxxxxxxxx Also got a funny thumb! until chage of tablets!
Posts.Title: Letrozole -hair loss

Posts.Content: hello everyone . re bras...the other week Gwok whatever... on This Morning discussed bras with a lady who had had a single mast.  I contacted the programme and asked them if they could do something about bras for ladies with double mast.... think they may consider it.... if we all got together who knows we might get a manufacturer interested or Macmillann could take up the cause? Yours flatly  xxx Zen
Posts.Title: Mastectomy Bras!
